description: Peak Saver is PNM's demand response program for large commercial and industrial customers in New Mexico. The program targets non-essential electric loads that can be reduced during periods of peak system demand. Participants receive annual incentives for reducing electricity demand during called events. The program has been operating since 2008 and is administered by Itron Inc. as a third-party contractor (previously managed by Enbala Power Networks). Events are called only when needed to maintain grid reliability, typically during summer afternoons.

utilities: Public Service Company of New Mexico (PNM)
service_territories: PNM service territory in New Mexico
geography.notes: PNM serves portions of New Mexico including Albuquerque and surrounding areas

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Customers on specific rate classes: 4B, 5B, 11B, 15B, 30B, and 35B. Also businesses with peak demand greater than 50kW on rate 3B.

eligibility.notes: Itron Inc. administers the program as third-party contractor. PNM works with businesses to identify curtailable electric load and measure/verify facility performance. Battery storage eligibility not explicitly mentioned in program documentation.

notification.notification_notes: At least 10 minutes advance notice before event start. In many cases, information about possible events can be provided many hours in advance. Businesses always have the option to withdraw from an event if operational constraints prevent participation.

capacity_rate.notes: Annual incentives provided based on amount of electricity managed during participation. Specific payment rates not publicly disclosed.

performance_rate.notes: Program provides annual incentives rather than per-event performance payments

penalty_structure.penalty_description: Participants can withdraw from events if operational constraints prevent participation - suggests penalties may not be strictly enforced

payment_structure.payment_notes: Annual incentive structure based on enrolled capacity and performance. Specific dollar amounts not publicly disclosed. Contact Joel Fisher (Itron) at joel.fisher@itron.com or 480-966-4739 for program details.

seasons.notes: Program operates primarily during summer peak demand periods June 1 - September 30, with events between 1 PM - 8 PM Monday-Friday. Can address peak demand requirements for up to 100 hours per year.

call_windows.notes: Events called 1 PM - 8 PM weekdays during June-September. Excludes holidays and weekends.

event_parameters.notes: Up to 100 hours per year during summer months. At least 10 minutes notification provided before events.

event_triggers.trigger_description: Events are called when PNM experiences high peak demand and anticipates the need for demand-side resources. System operators call demand response events only when needed for grid reliability during summer peak demand periods.
event_triggers.examples: Events typically called during hottest summer days in New Mexico, primarily July-August afternoons

nomination_bidding.notes: Enrollment appears ongoing. Contact Joel Fisher at Itron (joel.fisher@itron.com, 480-966-4739) for enrollment process. PNM works with each business to identify curtailable loads and establish baseline.

research_notes: Conducted web research on PNM Peak Saver program on 2025-10-12. Program is well-established (operating since 2008) but documentation is limited compared to other ISO/utility DR programs. Key findings: (1) Targets C&I customers with minimum 50 kW peak demand on eligible rate schedules; (2) Provides annual incentives but rates not disclosed publicly; (3) 10-minute minimum notification with flexibility to decline events; (4) Up to 100 hours/year during summer months (June-Sept, 1-8 PM weekdays); (5) Currently administered by Itron Inc.; (6) Battery storage eligibility not explicitly mentioned - would require direct inquiry. Contact Joel Fisher at Itron for enrollment details and payment rates. Program appears less structured than ISO-based DR programs with more flexible participation requirements. Data quality score of 4 reflects limited publicly available information on key financial parameters and operational details.

battery_suitability_assessment.technical_compatibility: MODERATE - 10-minute notification is adequate for battery dispatch but tighter than typical ISO programs (30-120 minutes). Summer-only operation and predictable call windows are favorable.
battery_suitability_assessment.regulatory_risk: LOW - Program has operated continuously since 2008 with consistent NMPRC approval. Stable regulatory environment in New Mexico.
battery_suitability_assessment.notes: Battery suitability is rated MODERATE primarily due to lack of explicit documentation regarding energy storage eligibility and undisclosed payment rates. The program structure (summer peak, afternoon events, flexible participation) is technically compatible with battery operations, but economic viability cannot be assessed without payment information. PNM has shown interest in battery storage through separate grid-scale procurement efforts, suggesting utility is storage-friendly, but Peak Saver program documentation does not specifically address behind-the-meter batteries. For a definitive assessment, direct contact with program administrator is required.

integration_metadata.notes: Program is established and actively operating but documentation is limited compared to ISO-administered programs. PNM service territory is relatively small compared to major ISOs, which may explain less formalized program structure. The flexibility to decline events suggests program is more relationship-based than strictly contracted, which could be positive or negative depending on participant preferences. For battery optimization purposes, this program would likely be a secondary revenue stream stacked with energy arbitrage and other services rather than primary DR program given limited hours (100/year) and undisclosed payments.
